Xalq ta’limi vazirligi “Elektron ta’lim” loyihasida Xitoy kompaniyalari bilan hamkorlik qiladi

04 Nov 2019, 11:02

Xalq ta’limi vazirligi mamlakatdagi barcha maktab o‘quvchilarining yuqori sifatli ta’lim olishi uchun “Elektron ta’lim” loyihalarini amalga oshirishni rejalashtirmoqda. Bu haqda vazirlik matbuot xizmati xabar berdi.


Foto: Xalq ta’limi vazirligi matbuot xizmati

Xitoy davlat kengashi bosh vaziri Li Ketsyanning O‘zbekistonga tashrifi doirasida Xalq ta’limi vazirligi Xitoyning ZTE va Huawei kompaniyalari bilan “Xalq ta’limi tizimida zamonaviy axborot-kommunikatsiya texnologiyalarini joriy etish” loyihalarini amalga oshirish uchun kelishuvlarni imzoladi.
Kelishuvlar doirasida xitoylik kompaniyalar o‘z hisoblaridan bir necha maktablarda zamonaviy axborot-kommunikatsiya texnologiyalarini joriy etish bo‘yicha pilot loyihalarni amalga oshiradi. Loyiha natijalariga ko‘ra, joriy etilgan texnologiyalarning ta’lim sifatini oshirishdagi va maktab boshqaruv tizimidagi samaradorligi o‘rganib chiqiladi.
Loyihalar ijobiy natija ko‘rsatsa tomonlar Xitoy moliya tashkilotlaridan mablag‘ jalb qilgan holda axborot texnologiyalarini bosqichma bosqich joriy etish masalalarini o‘rganib chiqadi.
Bundan tashkari, o‘zbekistonlik mutaxassislar Xitoyning maktablarda zamonaviy axborot texnologiyalarini joriy etish bo‘yicha ilg‘or tajribasini o‘rganishlari kutilmoqda.

The Ministry of Public Education is partnering with Chinese companies in the e-learning project

04 Nov 2019, 11:02 AM

The Ministry of Public Education plans to implement e-education projects to provide high-quality education to all students in the country. The press service of the ministry reports.


Photo: Press Service of the Ministry of Public Education

In the framework of the visit of the Premier of the State Council of China Li Keqiang to Uzbekistan, the Ministry of Public Education has signed agreements with ZTE and Huawei on implementation of the project "Introduction of modern information and communication technologies in the public education system".
As part of the agreements, Chinese companies will implement at their own expense a pilot project to introduce modern information and communication technologies in several schools. The project will examine the effectiveness of the implemented technologies in improving the quality of education and the school management system.
If the projects succeed, the parties will study the step-by-step introduction of information technology with the involvement of Chinese financial institutions.
In addition, Uzbek specialists are expected to learn Chinese best practices in implementing modern information technologies in schools.
